detailedSummary: The future tense expresses actions that will happen. Regular future endings are added to the infinitive: -é, -ás, -á, -emos, -éis, -án. Examples: 'hablaré' (I will speak), 'comerás' (you will eat), 'viviremos' (we will live). Irregular futures have stem changes: tener → tendré, hacer → haré, decir → diré, poder → podré, querer → querré, saber → sabré, venir → vendré, salir → saldré, poner → pondré. The conditional expresses 'would' actions and polite requests. Regular conditional endings: -ía, -ías, -ía, -íamos, -íais, -ían. Examples: 'hablaría' (I would speak), 'comerías' (you would eat). Irregular conditionals use the same stems as irregular futures: tendría, haría, diría, etc. Uses: future for predictions ('Lloverá mañana' - It will rain tomorrow), plans ('Viajaré a España' - I will travel to Spain); conditional for hypotheticals ('Comería pizza si tuviera hambre' - I would eat pizza if I were hungry), polite requests ('¿Podrías ayudarme?' - Could you help me?). Both tenses enable expressing future plans and hypothetical situations.
whyItMatters: Future and conditional tenses are essential for expressing plans, predictions, and hypothetical situations - mastering them enables advanced communication about possibilities and future events.

assignments.title: Master Future and Conditional
assignments.description: Practice using future and conditional tenses to express plans and hypothetical situations.
tasks: Conjugate regular verbs in future and conditional tenses
Memorize and practice irregular future and conditional forms
Write 15 sentences about your future plans using future tense
Write 15 sentences expressing hypothetical situations using conditional
Practice polite requests using conditional ('¿Podrías...?', '¿Te importaría...?')

quizzes.question: How do you form the future tense for regular verbs?
options: Add endings directly to the infinitive
quizzes.explanation: For regular verbs, you add future endings (-é, -ás, -á, etc.) directly to the infinitive form (hablar → hablaré, comer → comerás).

quizzes.question: The conditional tense is used for polite requests, like '¿Podrías ayudarme?' (Could you help me?).
quizzes.explanation: True. The conditional is commonly used for polite requests and hypothetical situations, making it essential for courteous communication.

quizzes.question: What is the future form of 'tener' (to have) for 'yo'?
quizzes.explanation: 'Tendré' is the irregular future form of 'tener' for 'yo' (I will have). Many common verbs have irregular future stems.
